oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Inverse of the distance matrix of a block graph
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BAPAT, RB
SIVASUBRAMANIAN, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: distance matrix
determinant
Laplacian matrix
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A connected graph G, whose 2-connected blocks are all cliques (of possibly varying sizes) is called a block graph. Let D be its distance matrix. By a theorem of Graham, Hoffman and Hosoya, we have det(D) not equal 0. We give a formula for both the determinant and the inverse, D(-1) of D.
